alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 2:55PM MDT until June 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding and potential for mud flows caused by excessive rainfall is possible in the East Troublesome burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Grand. * WHEN...Until 515 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding and mud flows are possible along CO-125 in the central part of the burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... CO-125 in the East Troublesome burn scar. Buffalo Creek, Denver Creek, Willow Creek, and Kauffman Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
